data.title: Our Lady Of Sorrows – Roman Catholic Perpetual Eucharistic Adoration Parish, 24 hours a day – 7 days a week
data.text:
Our Mission Statement

We are the family of Our Lady of Sorrows Parish, a community of individuals united by the love of Christ.

We reach out to all through prayer, spiritual formation, liturgical offerings, education, a welcoming spirit and service.

We are a Perpetual Adoration parish, sharing this opportunity with the surrounding communities.

Our Clergy

Mass Schedule

Sunday 8 a.m. Mass

10 a.m. Mass (Live-streamed) Monday 7:45 a.m. Daily Mass Tuesday 7:45 a.m. Daily Mass

6:30 p.m. Mass

St. Anthony Novena follows Wednesday 7:45 a.m. Daily Mass

Our Lady of Perpetual Help Novena follows Thursday 7:45 a.m. Daily Mass Friday 7:45 a.m. Daily Mass

Our Lady of Sorrows & All Consolation Novenas follow Saturday 8:00 a.m. Daily Mass

3:45 Confessions

5:00 p.m. Vigil Mass

We strongly encourage our parishioners to avail themselves of other opportunities by taking part in spiritual exercises in their home: watching Mass on TV, reading the Bible, listening to Catholic radio/podcasts, or praying the rosary.

REGISTRATION FOR NEW PARISHIONERS:

Please call or stop into the Parish Office to fill out a registration form. We would appreciate notification if you move or change your registration at anytime.

PARISH MEMBERSHIP:

A parishioner is one who belongs to the Our Lady of Sorrows Parish Community. As such, are committed to worship and participate spiritually, socially and financially in the life of the Parish. Adults over the age of 21 should register independently from your parent’s registration.

BAPTISMS:

Baptisms are held on the second Sunday of the month at 11:30 a.m. or during the 10:00 a.m. Mass.

Baptismal Preparation Class is held on the third Monday of the month at 7 p.m. in the Church.

Baptism Information — Deacon Joe Lonergan

Please contact the Parish Office to register.

MARRIAGES:

The Common Policy for all the Dioceses of New Jersey requires a period of preparation for the Sacrament of Matrimony. Arrangements should be made one year in advance. Please call the Parish Office to schedule your appointment with the Parish priest, before any social plans are finalized.

PASTORAL CARE OF THE SICK:

Arrangements for Communion Calls to the sick at home can be made by calling the Parish Office. Please notify the Parish Office when a parishioner is in the hospital.

SCHOOL OF RELIGIOUS EDUCATION:

Please leave a voicemail for Mrs. Betty Napoli 609-927-0121 or email:

Email: bettynapoli@gmail.com or parish Office at:

SRE@ourladyofsorrows.comcastbiz.net

KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS:

GEORGE MACDONALD

LEGION OF MARY:

The Legion of Mary is a lay apostolic association of Catholic men and women who have formed

themselves into a body to be of service to the Church.

Tuesdays at 9:30 a.m. in Annex.

You are welcome to join us. Please contact Linda Tuccinardi at 609 653-8152.

HOLY SPIRIT PRAYER GROUP:

Tuesdays at 1 p.m. – 2:30 p.m. in Annex.

Learn about the Gifts of the Holy Spirit. Just come and join us.

Spiritual Director: Father Jomon George,M.SS.CC Missionary of the Sacred Hearts

Please contact Susan Scott for more info.

THE PRECIOUS BLOOD DEVOTIONS:

Wednesdays at 7:00p.m – 8:00 p.m.

A prayer group praying The Precious Blood Devotions gathers together before the Blessed Sacrament in church every Friday.

All are welcome!!

CIRCLE OF PRAYER:

Request prayers or participate 609-927-6047

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS MEETINGS:

In Annex Wednesday & Friday & Saturday 7 to 8 p.m. 609-641-8855

AL-ANON MEETINGS:

Al-Anon is for everyone who is dealing with a loved one or a friend who drinks too much.

Meetings: In Annex Wednesday & Friday & Saturday 7 to 8 p.m. 609-641-8855

GAMBLERS ANONYMOUS:

In Annex, Thursday 7 p.m. 856-429-6516

BINGO:

Fridays at 7:00 p.m. – 9:30 p.m. $1000 prizes
